Articles.Content:
Anyone else want to dogfight?

http://www./download/6ljokp7gmnuul99/FA-33_GoldenHawk.craft

That guy never lost a fight.

I have a new ship. I know that the six (6) and eight (8) hull corner armoring layout is over used but I have no choice it's the most basic and also the most practical scheme to shape your ships after.

Wow, Zamo, that is the coolest ship I think i've seen... I've never actually seen an 8 hull corner layout before, so I guess it's not very overrated.

What planet pack adds that "colony planet"?

- - - Updated - - -

lol that thing has over 800 parts, how the hell did you get two in one place?
Yea, so many people avoided the layout because it was seen as overused that it isn't used very much at all.

lol that thing has over 800 parts, how the hell did you get two in one place?

Even I'm not this bad with part count anymore.
What I wanna know is how the heck he even fit 800 parts in that ship.

What I wanna know is how the heck he even fit 800 parts in that ship.

Too much armor, lots of Struts, complex missiles. I used to get 700-800 parts in a 110 ton drek.

Heck, I've made a 3 ton tank that was 150 parts.

I have a new ship. I know that the six (6) and eight (8) hull corner armoring layout is over used but I have no choice it's the most basic and also the most practical scheme to shape your ships after.

if your ships are like my ships they still die in one shot

if your ships are like my ships they still die in one shot

Probably. It's rare to have a ship survive more than 1, especially if that one is a popper. Most I've had to use on a ship was three, and that was my own ship.

Just curious but did the AI ever attempt to use the laser to destroy incoming missiles or is it beyond comprehension for that?

I didn't expect a victory either way, the Zarek is actually made for hit-and-run attacks at hypersonic speed and doesn't have advantage at low speed

No it did not. I had completely misread where you said you wanted to test its anti missile abilities

No it did not. I had completely misread where you said you wanted to test its anti missile abilities

well lucky for you I have also made a dogfighting craft you can also use

https://www.dropbox.com/s/tuy0rwmvsxlx6vd/Thassa-class%20Heavy%20Fighter.craft?dl=0

well lucky for you I have also made a dogfighting craft you can also use

https://www.dropbox.com/s/tuy0rwmvsxlx6vd/Thassa-class%20Heavy%20Fighter.craft?dl=0

What I've notched is a lot of people are making their fighters more designed for tournament style combat rather than warfare.

Anyone who wants a craft tested and reviewed by me can put a file on my thread:

Here

Wow, Zamo, that is the coolest ship I think i've seen... I've never actually seen an 8 hull corner layout before, so I guess it's not very overrated.

What planet pack adds that "colony planet"?

- - - Updated - - -

lol that thing has over 800 parts, how the hell did you get two in one place?

I just made that colony planet from scratch and edited the pic for added effects, btw I just cleaned my computer I think I'm back again making part count monster creation, turns out my computer was full of dust now it's a lot faster.

Yea, so many people avoided the layout because it was seen as overused that it isn't used very much at all.

That is true, guess I revived it again.

Probably. It's rare to have a ship survive more than 1, especially if that one is a popper. Most I've had to use on a ship was three, and that was my own ship.

Yeah basically, since I was lagging in development compared to others my ships usually die in two shots now its survived in 2 shots with a 50/50 chance on surviving a third. I'm proud with that honestly. To be specific I used my heavy tirepedoes not your regular I-Beams.

What I wanna know is how the heck he even fit 800 parts in that ship.
Too much armor, lots of Struts, complex missiles. I used to get 700-800 parts in a 110 ton drek.

Heck, I've made a 3 ton tank that was 150 parts.

Yep haven't you read it? up to five layers on the core and center of the ship. Plus heavy partcount weapons (But I tell you they are deadly and worth the partcount invested in them)

if your ships are like my ships they still die in one shot
Probably. It's rare to have a ship survive more than 1, especially if that one is a popper. Most I've had to use on a ship was three, and that was my own ship.

Nah I'm pretty confident that my ship can survive up to three shots. I tested it myself. But that was using my tirepedoes I don't know if any variants of missiles like Zeke's Poppers or another copied version of my Tirepedo is more powerful. If that's the case I want to use my ship in actual battle. Now I'm looking or challenge.

Now I'm looking or challenge.

*twitches*

To Battle Stations!...

"BASIL" Battlecruiser Craft File: http://www./download/nnw6v4z75e3j60w/BASIL.craft

Let's fight while I still have internet access (I'm on dial-up so bear with me the line is unstable)

It took some good hits - the engines were particularly weak, and the sides caved after one popper. I'm sure with a tad bit of practice I can one-shot it, Probably the best place to kill it is the side from 400ish meters.

This was three seperate hits that weren't aligned at all.

So I started work on a new hull for a Battleship.

It's the "Typhoon" variant of the Vindicator. I call it the Pocket Vindicator. Better armour, same armament, lower part count, lower weight.

419m shot, right down the side, beautiful phasing..... it tore the gut right out of the BASIL. Really weird, going to try again. The camera froze right as the Popper was in the center of the ship, so I assume the most perfect clipping shot has ever been acheived.
zekes y u no make SU-47

Shhhhh... It's perfect

Vindicator Class "Typhoon" Pocket Battleship.

What do you mean a "Pocket" Battleship? Does it mean a Heavy Cruiser/Battlecruiser or just a regular Cruiser in terms of size and tonnage? Or does this "Pocket" mean that I can put it in my real pocket and take it as a prize token after killing it in battle?

The images are taking forever to load for me Zekes so I can't see it.

It took some good hits - the engines were particularly weak, and the sides caved after one popper. I'm sure with a tad bit of practice I can one-shot it, Probably the best place to kill it is the side from 400ish meters.

This was three separate hits that weren't aligned at all.

http://i.imgur.com/7EaSlli.png

Yeah I can agree with the engines at the back are exposed but they are eight so I guess it can still move even after you destroy some of it. The sides were supposed to take of layer by layer, I make Reactive Armors remember, not solid armors. Solid armors are only found at the core of the BASIL Battlecruiser.

If you can one shot it please tell me the details. I'm pretty interested with the results and conditions.

419m shot, right down the side, beautiful phasing..... it tore the gut right out of the BASIL. Really weird, going to try again. The camera froze right as the Popper was in the center of the ship, so I assume the most perfect clipping shot has ever been acheived.

http://i.imgur.com/1BoxcCu.png

HA! It's a worthy ship then. I bet the other engines were still functional. Even though you destroyed the center engine it can still move (Although I've gotta admit I was trying to protect it the most of the other engines not like the other exposed engines). It's only a matter of time before you can one shot it.

During an engagement that would be critically helpful because most ships after taking that kind of perfect clipping/phasing hit/shot would get destroyed and most probably couldn't move.

Good thing the BASIL has redundant engines. Although I've got to say I'm still impressed up to this day with your Poppers. My Tirepedoes are about 2/3 of the power from my observation. Mostly my Tirepedoes almost always reach the center but not the core when I take shots at it (Although I consciously reduced the partcount, tonnage and power of my current Tirepedoes unlike the prior generatios), but yours completely penetrated the center (Though I may attribute it your advanced experience it taking shots so I really don't know, I know I lack taking at different angles at a ship I usually just shoot at the center)

So want to have a formal fight or what?

Edited November 6, 2015 by Zamovinar

Yeah I can agree with the engines at the back are exposed but they are eight so I guess it can still move even after you destroy some of it. The sides were supposed to take of layer by layer, I make Reactive Armors remember, not solid armors. Solid armors are only found at the core of the BASIL Battlecruiser.

If you can one shot it please tell me the details. I'm pretty interested with the results and conditions.

HA! It's a worthy ship then. I bet the other engines were still functional. Even though you destroyed the center engine it can still move (Although I've gotta admit I was trying to protect it the most of the other engines not like the other exposed engines). It's only a matter of time before you can one shot it.

During an engagement that would be critically helpful because most ships after taking that kind of perfect clipping/phasing hit/shot would get destroyed and most probably couldn't move.

Good thing the BASIL has redundant engines. Although I've got to say I'm still impressed up to this day with your Poppers. My Tirepedoes are about 2/3 of the power from my observation. Mostly my Tirepedoes almost always reach the center but not the core when I take shots at it (Although I consciously reduced the partcount, tonnage and power of my current Tirepedoes unlike the prior generatios), but yours completely penetrated the center (Though I may attribute it your advanced experience it taking shots so I really don't know, I know I lack taking at different angles at a ship I usually just shoot at the center)

So want to have a formal fight or what?

Ehh, sure, why not, I think I have the numbers advantage but you have the armor. You set up some ships I'll bring an equal force.
Save file: http://www./download/hc9yb2i4rbjx9xz/BASIL+BATTLECRUISERS.sfs
